snippet: The hairline cracks are tied to a change in the manufacturing process of the carbon composite wings by Mitsubishi Heavy Industries in Japan, and do not affect planes in use, Boeing says.
abstract: Boeing says it has discovered tiny cracks in wings of about 40 Dreamliners currently in production; says hairline cracks are tied to change in manufacturing process of carbon composite wings by Mitsubishi Heavy Industries in Japan, and do not affect planes in use.
lead_paragraph: The hairline cracks are tied to a change in the manufacturing process of the carbon composite wings by Mitsubishi Heavy Industries in Japan, and do not affect planes in use, Boeing says.
